nodes.bodyText: This could be interpreted as "if the _source_includes parameter is set, then this parameter is ignored", whereas in reality they're both considered. You can use _source_includes and _source_excludes in conjunction with each other to filter down the source.

nodes.bodyText: To me we should omit the part "This does not include ...", since this section is meant to be a simple API reference. That sentence is more of a 'note' or helpful reminder that the document source does not contain these values (which we already mention in the more detailed/ explanatory 'run a search' reference).

@@ -302,6 +327,58 @@ If the <<search-api-scroll-query-param,`scroll` parameter>> is specified, this
 value cannot be `0`.

+`_source`::
+(Optional)
+Indicates which <<mapping-source-field,source fields>> are returned for matching
+documents. These fields are returned in the `hits._source` property of
+the search response. Defaults to `true`.
++
+.Valid values for `_source`
+[%collapsible%open]
+====
+`true`::
+(boolean)
+The entire document source is returned. This does not include:
+* <<multi-fields,multi-fields>>
+* <<alias,field aliases>>
+* Values copied using the <<copy-to,`copy_to`>> mapping parameter
+
+`false`::
+(boolean)
+The document source is not returned.
+
+`<wildcard_pattern>`::
+(string)
+Wildcard (`*`) patterns containing source fields to return.

nodes.bodyText:
This adds some CSS styling to better render collapsible sections for nested properties.
Because we don't want the styling on all collapsible sections, we have to add this attribute
so our build attaches the child_attributes CSS class to the section.
Here's an example of how it looks when rendered:

nodes.bodyText: Similar comment to above, you can use includes and excludes in conjunction with each other.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -302,6 +327,58 @@ If the <<search-api-scroll-query-param,`scroll` parameter>> is specified, this
 value cannot be `0`.
 --
 
+`_source`::
+(Optional)
+Indicates which <<mapping-source-field,source fields>> are returned for matching
+documents. These fields are returned in the `hits._source` property of
+the search response. Defaults to `true`.
++
+.Valid values for `_source`
+[%collapsible%open]
+====
+`true`::
+(boolean)
+The entire document source is returned. This does not include:
+* <<multi-fields,multi-fields>>
+* <<alias,field aliases>>
+* Values copied using the <<copy-to,`copy_to`>> mapping parameter
+
+`false`::
+(boolean)
+The document source is not returned.
+
+`<wildcard_pattern>`::
+(string)
+Wildcard (`*`) patterns containing source fields to return.
+
+`<wildcard_pattern_array>`::
+(array of strings)
+Array of wildcard (`*`) patterns containing source fields to return.
+
+`<object>`::
+(object)
+Object containing a list of source fields to include or exclude.
++
+.Properties for `<object>`
+[%collapsible%open]
+=====
+`includes`::
+(array of strings)
+Array of wildcard (`*`) patterns containing source fields to return.
++
+If this property is specified, only source fields that match these patterns are
+returned. You can exclude fields from this subset using the `excludes` property.
+
+`excludes`::
+(array of strings)
+Array of wildcard (`*`) pattern containing source fields to exclude from the
+response.
++
+If the `includes` property is not specified, the entire document source is returned,
